Description: Fragment of a polychrome glazed composition inlay element, probably the tail-end of a duck, detailed in light blue, dark blue, black and white.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, House TA:29/106 The North Suburb, the Eastern Quarter, House V.36.11.
Curator's comments: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2:26, pl. XXX, fig.1.

Colourful faience inlays were a feature of house, temple and palace decoration at Tell el-Amarna. See, for example: Fairman, City of Akhenaten II (London, 1933): pl.30 Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III (London, 1951): pls.62, 72 Pharaohs of the Sun (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1999): 228
Exhibition history: 2012 7 December - Sat 13 April 2013, Berlin, Neues Museum, In the Light of Amarna
